caption.text: This is a map of Boston from 1739, the year the Workhouse was finished.

Here, you can see the Workhouse. We know from documents that they were next to each other, so the Almshouse was here as well. On the border of the Common and the Burying Place, the Almshouse occupied a prime area of Beacon Hill, which was growing in this era.

Here, you can see how the area around the Almshouse was under developed when it was built. As the neighborhood grew, the Almshouse would interact with its neighbors more, and become a larger part of the Beacon Hill neighborhood.
Here is a map of Boston from 1814, 13 years after the Almshouse was moved.
The neighborhood of Beacon Hill and the area adjacent to the Common was significantly more developed than it was in 1739.
